hint.text: Total cost of land = Cost of buying land + cost of tilling land

solution.text:
Given that :
a = _{{6*j}}_, b = _{{8*j}}_ and c =_{{10*j}}_
By Heron's Formula :
Area = \(\sqrt {s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}\)
Where, s = \({a+b+c}\over 2\) = \( _{{6*j}}_+_{{8*j}}_+_{{10*j}}_\over 2\) = _{{(6*j+8*j+10*j)/2}}_
Therefore, applying Heron's Formula :
Area = \(\sqrt{_{{12*j}}_(_{{12*j}}_-_{{6*j}}_)(_{{12*j}}_-_{{8*j}}_)(_{{12*j}}_-_{{10*j}}_)}\)
Area = \(\sqrt{_{{12*j}}_(_{{6*j}}_)(_{{4*j}}_)(_{{2*j}}_)}\)
Area = \(\sqrt{_{{24*24*j*j*j*j}}_}\)
Area = _{{24*j*j}}_
Cost of tiling = Area of land\(\times \)cost per metre
i.e., Cost of tiling = _{{24*j*j}}_\(\times \)_{k}_
i.e., Cost of tiling = _{{24*j*j*k}}_
Total cost = cost of buying + cost of tiling
Total cost = _{{5000*k+3000*j}}_ + _{{24*j*j*k}}_
Total cost = _{{5000*k+3000*j+24*j*j*k}}_

content.text: A village farmer Rahul wants to buy a triangular piece of land of dimensions _{{6*j}}_, _{{8*j}}_ and _{{10*j}}_ m. After buying the land he realises it is not tilled and the cost of tilling is Rs. _{{10*k}}_ per square metre. If he bought the land for Rs. _{{5000*k+3000*j}}_, what is the total amount he spends on the land (including tilling)?
